titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Jan Williams Collection of Images, 1962-2007
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Molly O'Brien

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: Â© 2009. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by Molly O'Brien.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard ).

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Jan Williams Collection of Images, 1962-2007
did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The Jan Williams Collection of Images contains images of various performances and trips made by Jan Williams with accompanying performers and composers. An original gift was received of 321 prints and contact sheets and 54 35mm slides in 2007. An additional gift was received of 173 photographs in 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Jan Williams Collection of Images, 1962-2007, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: Entire collection digitized and available in UB Libraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jan Williams was born in Utica, New York in 1939. He earned his B.M. and M.M. degrees as a percussionist at the Manhattan School of Music where he studied with Paul Price. Williams came to Buffalo as a Creative Associate at the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts in 1964. He became a member of the University at Buffalo Music Faculty in 1967 and Co-Director of the Center in 1974. Williams has been a mainstay of the international contemporary music scene, as percussionist, conductor, administrator, and educator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Jan Williams Collection of Images consists of 548 photos, slides, and contact sheets, taken by Jan Williams, his friends, and professional photographers. The collection documents the career of Jan Williams and his travels to several countries, including Argentina, Brazil, Denmark, England, France, Germany, Italy, Poland, Spain, Uruguay, and many cities in the United States. More than one hundred images are of various venues in Buffalo, New York where Jan spent the bulk of his career. The collection contains images of many notable composers such as John Cage, Cornelius Cardew, Elliott Carter, David Del Tredici, Lukas Foss, Lejaren Hiller, Morton Feldman, Conlon Nancarrow, Pauline Oliveros, and Virgil Thomson. Performers represented in the images include the other members of the New Percussion Quartet, Creative Associates, Nils Vigeland, and Eberhard Blum.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into four series. Series I, II, and IV are prints of various sizes and Series III consists of 35mm slides.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Jan Williams Collection of Annotated Scores, 1950-1999 Mus. Arc. 10.1
defitem.item: 219 scores, most of which have been marked for performance.

defitem.label: Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams, 1974-1979 Mus. Arc. 2.3
defitem.item: The Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams date from concert tours made by Morton Feldman and the University at Buffalo's Creative Associates in 1974, 1977, and 1979.
